page.title: 20Summing up Scotforth area
page.content: Three quarters of the block is countryside. The majority of this is grazing land with several small woods and farms. There is a reservoir which is caaled Blea Tarn which supplies Lancaster, Morecambe, Heysham and surrounding areas. The A6 runs N-S. It has a single lane on each side and parallels the nearby M6. The railway runs practically alongside the A6. The main feature in our block is the University, completed in 1964 and six years later the recreation centre was opened. The univ. buildings are modern looking and built on a spine running down the length of the Univ. The central square is called Alexandra Sq. after the Princess who opened it. CONTRIBUTORS:Scotforth C of E Primary, Lancaster
